text.section:
The board may issue a "professional counselor associate" license to an applicant who:
Has completed all requirements under paragraphs (a) to (d) of subsection (1) of this section;
Has not met the requirements of paragraphs (e) or (f) of subsection (1) of this section; and
Has obtained a board-approved supervisor of record.

section.section: On July 15, 2002, a previously certified professional counselor in Kentucky shall be entitled to use the term "licensed professional clinical counselor" and shall be issued a professional clinical counselor license upon annual renewal.
An applicant who has been issued a professional clinical counselor license shall be entitled to use the title "licensed professional clinical counselor."

On July 15, 2002, a previously certified professional counselor associate shall be entitled to use the term "licensed professional counselor associate" and shall be issued a professional counselor associate license upon annual renewal.
An applicant who has been issued a professional counselor associate license shall be entitled to use the title "licensed professional counselor associate."
A licensed professional counselor associate shall maintain ongoing supervision as approved by the board.

A licensed professional counselor associate may apply for the credential of licensed professional clinical counselor upon completion of the hours of experience and passing the examinations required under paragraphs (e) and (f) of subsection (1) of this section.

text.section: The application fee for licensure and the examination fee shall be established pursuant to administrative regulation promulgated by the board.

law.history: Amended 2002 Ky. Acts ch. 79, sec. 5, effective July 15, 2002. -- Amended 2000 Ky. Acts ch. 252, sec. 3, effective July 14, 2000; and ch. 312, sec. 2, effective July 14, 2000. -- Created 1996 Ky. Acts ch. 364, sec. 6, effective July 15, 1996.
